TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr NORP , a lawyer practising in GPE , GPE .

The applicant is a sociologist and was at the material time employed by ORG ( Antirasistisk senter ) as a researcher . His application before the NORP relates to the publication of a book in respect of which he was found to have defamed PERSON The facts of the case , as described mainly in the national NORP judgments , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE ORG published a book , of which the applicant was the author , entitled “ At the extremity ” ( “ PERSON ytterst ” ) with the subtitle “ NORP groupings in GPE ” ( “ Rasistiske grupperinger i GPE ” ) . It was presented as a product of scientific research conducted by a sociologist , listing and describing the most important racist groupings and persons in GPE and presenting in chart form the connections between the various groupings . This included the names of CARDINAL persons , CARDINAL of whom had been convicted of offences of assault , some of murder , and sentenced to long terms of imprisonment .

The book comprised CARDINAL Chapters entitled : CARDINAL . ORG in GPE , CARDINAL . PERSON - nazism in NORP , CARDINAL . The Race Warriors , CARDINAL . GPE is Ours , CARDINAL . To ORG , CARDINAL . Many Rivers Small , CARDINAL . PERSON ’s Successors or just Silly People ( this LAW was divided into CARDINAL sections : a. ORG but these are only Appearances , b. Contacts Abroad , c. Words and Contents , d. Methods , e. Consequences ) , CARDINAL . ORG , and CARDINAL . But is that Something to be Concerned About ?
On the cover of the book , the following is stated about the book ’s contents :
“ AT THE EXTREME is the first book to give an insight into current racist groupings in GPE .

DATE people in GPE laughed at ORG distributing leaflets stating : ‘ GPE for the NORP - foreigners get out’ . DATE the laughter has calmed down . Since the reunification CARDINAL persons have been killed by ORG .
Many people wonder whether the same could happen in GPE . Are the racist groupings in GPE PERSON ’s successors or are they just a gang of silly fools ?
No other political issue in GPE has roused people to the extent of the debate on immigration .
There are DATE CARDINAL racist groupings which are against immigration .
Who are they ? What do they do ?
What consequences will this have for NORP society ?
The answers may be found in this book . ”
The book ’s foreword includes the following statement :

“ Many call them racists . They call themselves NORP , PERSON , racists , nationalists or patriots . The labelling may be practical but the substance is more important . The groupings mentioned in this book are described as racists because , by words and deeds , they discriminate and harass individuals and groups on grounds of their ethnic origin , culture or religion .
People who form part of racist groups are not of any singular kind . They are not monsters , PERSON fans or mad . They are like ordinary people – almost .

Their solution to problems of anxiety and discontent , a channel for their hatred DATE is to have somebody to blame : If we get rid of immigrants , we may also be able to get rid of social problems such as narcotics , rape , stabbing and social security fraud ? ”
In LAW , at page CARDINAL , a certain PERSON is mentioned as follows :
“ ACROSS PARTY LINES ELECTORAL INITIATIVE ( PERSON DATE hereinafter referred to as “ the TVI ” )

The above grouping is actually registered as a party . Its leader is Ms I .- M. L. , and it operates from a mailbox at GPE . It is a newsletter party which seldom appears publicly , except for Ms I .- M.L. ’s participation in certain TV debates and her leaflets for ORG ( ORG ) . ”
The introduction to LAW stated that there were CARDINAL registered parties hostile to immigrants in GPE and that

“ DATE the parties emerge as an attempt to dress racism with a suit and a tie in order to lure people into believing that it is ‘ an entirely ordinary party’ on the same line as other established parties . ”
In LAW a. , at page CARDINAL , it is stated :

“ As usual in NORP society , it is men , in particular elderly men , who are the leaders , except for PERSON ( Najonaldemokratene ) and PERSON ( PERSON ) . The average age is lower within the militant groupings , but men lead these too . In the skin head milieus there is a stronger presence of young women than in other groups . ”

Contrary to what is stated above , the ORG was not a registered political party but a grouping of CARDINAL persons . Under LAW of the Parliamentary , County , and LAW DATE ( LAW No . CARDINAL , Valgloven ) , the signature of CARDINAL persons entitled to vote in NORP elections is a prerequisite for the registration of a party by the competent authority , namely the notarius publicus in GPE . The lists of registered political parties are publicised . At present , there are CARDINAL registered political parties in GPE .

On DATE Ms I .- M.L. instituted proceedings against the applicant before ORG , claiming that the manner in which she had been mentioned in the applicant ’s book constituted unlawful accusations of racism which were defamatory and warranted compensation . She felt particularly aggrieved and defenceless against such research , which was on a different level from ordinary public discussion . The risk of being described as a racist made it impossible to express one ’s opinions in a public debate . Following the book ’s publication , she feared reprisals from the far left and had had to bear derogatory remarks from neighbours . She was of the firm opinion that she was not a racist .

By judgment of CARDINAL DATE , ORG acquitted the applicant . While finding that the book had indeed labelled Ms I .- M.L. as a racist it considered that it had been justified . In ORG view the classical lexical definition of racism , which related to the belief that CARDINAL race was superior to another according to physical and mental distinctions , ought to be supplemented by a more modern understanding of the concept . Ms ORG had , by her own words and public connections , handled questions of immigration policy in a manner which , she should expect , would spark off reactions .
Ms I .- M.L. appealed to ORG ( PERSON ) , which in a judgment of DATE found unjustified defamation within the meaning of LAW .

ORG observed that , given the book ’s title , in particular its subtitle , the comments on its cover page and the foreword , PERSON group , the LAW , was to be perceived as a racist group by the ordinary reader . The description of that group contained no reservation such as that made with respect to ORG . The accusation of racism not only concerned the ORG but also extended to Ms I .- M.L. She was mentioned as the leader of the group and her name was cited twice . The book ’s own definition of the concept of racism stated in the foreword should be decisive for the ordinary reader ’s understanding of the book . Given the text on the cover page , taking as a starting point NORP PERSON and mentioning that DATE people had been killed by such NORP , the reader would get the impression that the book dealt with clearly racist groups .

However , while Ms I .- M.L. ’s remarks published by ORG about the lack of common traditions between NORP and many immigrants or foreigners were deemed to border on racism , ORG did not find that any of her published statements constituted proof of racism , even though they might be perceived as offensive by some immigrants . Her participation in a certain seminar ( at which representatives of a number of racist groupings had been present ) also fell within her freedom of expression and opinion . The same applied to the fact that , for a short time , she had held a post on ORG interim governing ORG board in GPE . Since these matters did not justify describing her as a racist the applicant had failed to prove that the accusations made against her were true .

Moreover , while the accusations – which encompassed allegations of discrimination and harassment on ethnic grounds – had been expressed in a book written by a researcher for ordinary sale and were serious , the applicant ’s investigations into Ms I .- M.L. had been clearly deficient . The information contained in the book about Ms I .- M.L. and her group was erroneous , namely , the allegations that the group ORG had been registered as a political party , that FAC had taken part in television debates and that she had been involved in the distribution of leaflets for ORG . It was clear that the applicant had in part confused Ms I .- M.L. with someone else . In the view of ORG , had the applicant met the requirement of diligence that ought to apply , he would have avoided such errors , with the result that the ORG would have appeared as a particularly marginal group of little public interest . Probably , if the applicant had carried out reasonable research , this group would not even have been mentioned in the book .

Considering the case as a whole , ORG found that the accusation that PERSON was racist , according to the book ’s own definition , must be deemed inappropriate , and constituted punishable defamation .

Under LAW of LAW DATE ( Skadeserstatningsloven – Law no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) , ORG ordered the applicant to pay MONEY ( ORG ) to PERSON in compensation for non - pecuniary damage . The amount awarded took into account that , to the extent that she felt defamed , she had brought this largely on herself by her affirmations and recommendations . She had expressed views which had been offensive to many immigrants and which , if they were to be accepted , would make their situation difficult in GPE . Regard was also had to the fact that the book had brought the applicant little profit . Finally the applicant was ordered to pay ORG CARDINAL for her costs before ORG and ORG .
On DATE ORG of ORG ( Høyesteretts kjæremålsutvalg ) refused the applicant leave to appeal .
